Palmer u intervjuu makedonskoj TV zapretio sancijama Srbiji ako nabavi ruske raketne sisteme

02 Nov 2019, 11:20

Specijalni predstavnik američkog državnog sekretara za Zapadni Balkan Metju Palmer izrazio je danas zabrinutost SAD zbog prisustva ruske vojne opreme u Srbiji i zapretio sankcijama ako Beograd nabavi ruske raketne sisteme."Postoji doza zabrinutosti zbog rasporedjivanja ruske vojne opreme na teritoriji Srbije, ali i zbog mogućnosti da Srbija traži specifične ruske sisteme. To bi vodilo riziku da joj se uvedu specifične sankcije zbog kupovine ruske vojne opreme. Nadamo se da su naši srpski partneri svesni toga", rekao je Palmer u intervjuu makedonskoj televiziji Alsat M.Američki diplomata je to rekao odgovarajući na pitanja kakav je stav SAD povodom nedavno održane vojne vežbe srpske i ruske vojske "Slovenski štit" i prisustva raketnog sistema S-400 u Beogradu.Palmer je istakao da je upravo Amerika najveći vojni partner Srbije, u čemu značanju ulogu ima Nacionalna garda Ohaja, ali da to ne znači da Beograd ne treba da saradjuje i pravi vojno partnerstvo sa Rusijom.Na nedavno održanoj vojnoj vežbi srpske i ruske vojske pod nazvom "Slovenski štit 2019" prvi put je van teritorije Rusije bio prikazan raketni sistem S-400.Predsednik Srbije Aleksandar Vučić je rekao juče novinarima da Srbija nema S-400, ali da nju "više ne mogu da ponižavaju kako su to činili od 2000. do 2012. godine, a na njihovu žalost, Srbija je danas mnogo uspešnija".

In an interview with Macedonian TV, Palmer threatened sanctions on Serbia if it acquired Russian missile systems

02 Nov 2019, 11:20

US Secretary of State Special Representative for the Western Balkans Matthew Palmer today expressed US concern over the presence of Russian military equipment in Serbia and threatened sanctions if Belgrade procured Russian missile systems. Serbia is looking for specific Russian systems. This would run the risk of imposing specific sanctions on the purchase of Russian military equipment. We hope that our Serbian partners are aware of this, "Palmer said in an interview with Macedonian television, Alsat M.American diplomat said in response to questions about the position of the United States on the recent military exercise of the Serbian and Russian military "Slovenian Shield" and the presence of the S-400 missile system in Belgrade.Palmer emphasized that America is the largest military partner of Serbia, with the importance of the Ohio National Guard, but that does not mean that Belgrade does not need to cooperate and forge a military partnership with Russia During a military exercise of the Serbian and Russian military called "Slovenian Shield 2019", the S-400 missile system was shown outside Russia for the first time. Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic told reporters yesterday that Serbia does not have the S-400, but that " they can demean as they did from 2000 to 2012, and unfortunately, Serbia is much more successful today.
